bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A guide dog team, service dog team or dog-in-training team may, in the same manner
          as would an individual who is not a member of any of those teams, enter and use any place,
          accommodation, building or conveyance to which the public is invited or has access,
          provided that the individual who is a member of the team ensures the dog that is a member
          of the team

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
does not occupy a seat in a public conveyance or a place where food is served or
            dispensed to the public, as the case may be, and
is held by a leash or harness.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
interfere with the exercise of the right of entry and use specified in
            subsection (1), or

charge a fee, in respect of the exercise of the right of entry and use specified
            in subsection (1), for the dog that is a member of a guide dog team, service dog team or
            dog-in-training team.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subsection (2) (a) does not apply if the advertisement or representation referred
          to in that subsection specifies that occupancy of the rental unit may entail sharing
          sleeping, bathroom or cooking facilities in the space with an individual from another
          family.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
A person must not falsely represent a dog as being a member of a guide dog team,
        service dog team, retired guide or service dog team or dog-in-training team.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subject to this section and the regulations, an individual may apply to the
          registrar for the issuance or renewal of one or more of the following
          certificates:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a blind person, a certificate certifying that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the dog identified in the certificate is a guide dog, and
the blind person and the dog are a guide dog team;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
in the case of a person with a disability, a certificate certifying
            that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the dog identified in the certificate is a service dog, and
the person with a disability and the dog are a service dog team;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a certificate certifying that the individual identified in the certificate is a
            dog trainer;

a certificate certifying that the individual and the dog identified in the
            certificate are a retired guide or service dog team.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application under subsection (1) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in the form and manner the registrar requires,

include or be accompanied by any information or document the regulations
            require, and
be accompanied by the prescribed fee, if any.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar may issue or renew a certificate referred to in section 5 (1), in a
          form satisfactory to the registrar, if the registrar is satisfied that the individual or
          the dog, or both, as the case may be, identified in the certificate meet all of the
          conditions, qualifications and requirements imposed under this Act and the
          regulations.
The registrar may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
impose on a certificate any terms and conditions that the registrar considers
            appropriate, and
amend or remove a term or condition of a certificate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A certificate expires at the end of the day specified in the
          certificate.
A blind person and a dog are deemed to be certified as a guide dog team if the person holds a valid identification card issued to the team by an accredited or recognized training school.

A person with a disability and a dog are deemed to be certified as a service dog team if the person holds a valid identification card issued to the team by an accredited or recognized training school.
Certification of a guide dog team under subsection (1) or a service dog team under subsection (2) ends on the earlier of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the expiry date specified on the identification card;
the date on which an accredited or recognized training school revokes the identification card it issued to the team.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Cancellation of or refusal to renew certificate

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subject to the regulations, the registrar may cancel or refuse to renew a
          certificate

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
if the registrar is satisfied that the individual to whom the certificate is
            issued

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
ceases to meet any of the conditions, qualifications or requirements imposed
              under this Act or the regulations, or

fails to comply with any of the terms, conditions or requirements imposed
              under this Act or the regulations,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the dog identified in the certificate

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: dies or becomes permanently disabled, or

ceases to meet any of the conditions, qualifications or requirements imposed
              under this Act or the regulations, as the registrar determines, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in other prescribed circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar must notify in writing the individual to whom a certificate is
          issued of the registrar's decision under subsection (1) to cancel or refuse to renew the
          certificate.

An individual to whom a certificate is issued must, on the request of the
          registrar, surrender the certificate to the registrar.

A person who contravenes section 2 (2) (a) or (b), 3 (2) (a) or (b), 4 or 7 (3)
          commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of not more than
          $3 000.

bcl:text.#text:
Section 5 of the  does not apply for the
          purposes of this Act.

The minister must appoint, under the , an individual as the Registrar of Guide Dogs and Service
          Dogs.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar has the powers and duties conferred or imposed on the registrar
          under this Act.

The registrar may delegate, in writing, any power or duty of the registrar under
          this Act to a person employed in the ministry of the minister.

An individual to whom a certificate is issued may request the registrar to
          reconsider a decision under section 7 (1) to cancel or refuse to renew the
          certificate

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within 30 days after receiving notice of the decision, or

within the period of time the registrar specifies, if the registrar is satisfied
            that special circumstances existed that precluded the filing of a request for
            reconsideration within the period of time required under paragraph (a) of this
            subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An individual must make the request under subsection (1) in writing and must
          identify the error the individual believes was made or the other grounds on which a
          reconsideration is requested.

On receiving a request from an individual under this section, the registrar
          must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: confirm, vary or cancel the decision under section 7 (1), and

notify the individual in writing of the registrar's decision under paragraph (a)
            of this subsection and of the reasons for the decision.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar may conduct a hearing under this section

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in writing, electronically or orally, or
by any combination of written, electronic or oral hearings.

bcl:text.#text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41
          of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make
          regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
respecting certificates, including, without limitation, the types or classes of
            certificates, and prescribing terms and conditions for certificates;
for the purposes of section 5 (2) (c), prescribing fees;

for the purposes of section 7 (1), respecting the process the registrar must
            follow in cancelling or refusing to renew a certificate;

for the purposes of section 7 (1) (c), prescribing circumstances in which the
            registrar may cancel or refuse to renew a certificate;
defining "accredited or recognized training school".

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
In making a regulation under this Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may do
          one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: delegate a matter to a person;
confer a discretion on a person;

make different regulations for different certificates, places, dogs, persons or
            organizations, for different types or classes of certificates or for different classes
            of places, dogs, persons or organizations.

bcl:text.#text:
The following apply in respect of an animal that was a guide animal under the

          Act and a person to whom a certificate was issued under section 7 of that Act for the
          guide animal:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a guide animal for a blind person,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the guide animal is deemed to be a guide dog under this Act,

bcl:text.#text:
the guide animal and the person to whom a certificate was issued under section
              7 of the  are deemed to be a
              guide dog team under this Act, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a guide animal for a person other than a blind person,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the guide animal is deemed to be a service dog under this Act,

bcl:text.#text:
the guide animal and the person to whom a certificate was issued under section
              7 of the  are deemed to be a
              service dog team under this Act, and

the certificate issued under section 7 of the  is deemed to be a certificate referred to in section 5 (1)
              (b) of this Act and issued under section 6 (1) of this Act in respect of the guide
              animal and the person referred to in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting any other provision of this Act, the registrar may do one or more
          of the following in respect of a certificate referred to in subsection (1) (a) (iii) or
          (b) (iii):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
request the holder of the certificate to surrender the certificate to the
            registrar;

issue to the holder of the certificate a new certificate in a form satisfactory
            to the registrar;

impose on the certificate, or on the new certificate referred to in
            paragraph (b) of this subsection, any terms or conditions that the registrar considers
            appropriate, including, without limitation, an expiry date for the purposes of section 6
            (3) of this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in
        Council.
